articles.title: 10,000 BTC Bought by Whales Overnight: What Does it Mean for Bitcoin's Price?
articles.author: Crypto Potato
articles.summary: In the last 24 hours, large Bitcoin holders, also known as whales, have added more than 10,000 BTC to their wallets. The move follows a steady period of selling, making this sudden shift in accumulation noteworthy as Bitcoin trades near major. Bitcoin has always rebounded when traders' realized losses fell below -12%.

articles.title: Vanuatu revokes Pacific Private Bank's license after OCCRP investigation exposes crypto scandal
articles.author: Blitz
articles.summary: The Reserve Bank of Vanuatu has revoked the international banking license of Pacific Private Bank. The bank was used to channel tens of millions of euros raised from investors in a cryptocurrency venture into private accounts and luxury properties. The decision marks a rare but significant step taken by the bank.

articles.title: Crypto Crime Spikes 1,400-Fold From South Korea to Cambodia as Sanctions Debate Heats Up
articles.author: Bitcoinist
articles.summary: Crypto-linked crime from South Korea to Cambodia has skyrocketed 1,400 times in the past year. Transfers between the two nations mostly involve USDT stablecoins. Korean exchanges like Bithumb and Upbit processed these transactions. It's difficult to detect all suspicious transactions before they occur.
